Non-Semantic HTML

This is an example of non-semantic HTML, where tags like <div> and <span> are used to structure content, without conveying the meaning of the content.

  • Uses generic tags like <div> and <span>.
  • Lacks accessibility for screen readers and SEO.
  • HTML structure is harder to understand and maintain.
  • All elements require explicit closing tags.
  • Self-closing tags not supported (e.g., <br> needs <br />).
